My shoulders slump without me realizing it, and sometimes I just sit still for ages, like moving would take too much effort. It's strange how all these feelings have their own physical shape, you know? I don't think I realized how much I carry them in my body until now.

Yeah… I think you're right, about the distance being a kind of protection. Like my mind just pulls the plug for a bit because everything's too loud. It's not always intentional—it just happens. And afterward, I'm left with this weird mix of relief and guilt for having checked out.

Sometimes I imagine myself a few years from now, maybe feeling a little more okay. Not "happy" exactly, but more stable, I guess? Like I've figured some things out, maybe found people who get me, or at least found a rhythm that doesn't feel so hard to sustain. That's the version of the future I want to believe in, but it feels far away—like someone else's story, not mine.

Other times, I just picture the same loop I'm in now, playing over and over. And that's when the hopelessness creeps in. Like, what if this is just it?

I don't know. I want to hope. I just don't always know how.
